question.body: An originating signal for activity in the autonomic nervous system can be found in what?

multiple_choice.choice: primary motor cortex in the central nervous system
brainstem in the central nervous system
a ganglion in the peripheral nervous system
an effector organ in the peripheral nervous system

response.feedback: Incorrect. Autonomic nervous system is not associated with conscious decisions.
Correct. One of the originating locations for signals in the autonomic nervous system is the brainstem. Signals also originate from hypothalamus and spinal cord.
Incorrect. ANS signals originate in CNS.
Incorrect. ANS signals originate in CNS.
